title: PSA: Camille is INTENDED to be a bruiser, as tanky as Irelia
body: She's a diver. I know her model and weapons look quite assassin-ish, and I am aware she might be HEAVILY overpowered. But she's intended to go Triforce/Botrk/one item wonder into hybrid/defensive items. "Tank Camille" will actually be the intended diver playstyle. The numbers might be outlandishly high, the cooldowns may be so low no one can catch her or run from her, but it's not a design issue. Or at least not a mismatch.

Nah, I hadn't played against her yet when I posted against it.  I've got no real opinion on her power level yet, not enough experience.  Just pointing out that your argument is pretty silly.  All the various champs with true damage have some means of playing around said true damage.  But most of them *also* have tools to invalidate the ability to play around said true damage.

From what little experience I have, though, I *can* say that Camille is stickier than Vi, which is saying quite a bit.

> But most of them also have tools to invalidate the ability to play around said true damage.

That is kinda necessary though:

If an ability can only be played around by the user itself, it's frustrating for the opponent because the outcome only depends on the actions of the user.

However, if you give an ability too much counterplay, it becomes frustrating for the user, as he can do everything perfectly and still not succeed because the enemy has more options than him.

The goal should be to find a point where both the user and the opponent have roughly the same influence at the outcome, whether it be a simple one (Annie R: Annie needs to get in range, opponent needs to stay out of range) or a very complex one (Azir's soldiers are zones of control that both he and his enemy can play around).
